content.en:
# Racing with Black Swans - Writing in the AI Era

You're running... and you feel the panting breath of technological changes catching up with you...

## June 2023

It's June 2023, I started writing. Half a year ago at the Infoshare AI conference, I talked about how maybe another AI winter isn't threatening us, but the time has come for stabilization and realistic assessment of technology capabilities, without the hype. Two weeks later a black swan slammed its wings into the world. ChatGPT.

## Race Against Time

I'm writing. The novel's action is set in the near future. Technological threads and the fates of characters intertwine in my imagination... and in the real world, in the present, the lightning-fast progress of technology makes me wonder if I'll manage to publish the book before it becomes outdated.

I invent new things, and then I read that someone is already testing such technological concepts (at least I can tell myself that I came up with it myself, and didn't copy).

## FOMO and Black Swans

The writing is going well, but I constantly feel it's too slow. So much is happening in AI that I start experiencing FOMO. I watch Wes Roth and Dave Shapiro to stay current and that has to suffice.

Second half of 2023 and experts say "it's just statistics". Other experts say "sparks of AGI". Still others talk about evidence of representations... Good thing I'm not writing about LLMs...

## End of the Race?

July 8, 2024 arrives when I put the last period. The race is over. It's not over. Still editing, typesetting... I'm working, still watching for black swans. It should be ok. Around the world voices about a plateau in AI are heard...

Now it's really over. The book is in readers' hands. Whether it will disappoint, intrigue, or maybe bore... I have no control over that anymore. And black swans can fly wherever they want.

Good thing this isn't a book about AI ğŸ˜‰

Though actually it kind of is
